intro: Ranunculus haesselbyholmiensis, commonly known as the Hesselby holm ranunculus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Scandinavia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features palmate leaves and produces small, yellow or white flowers with numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
